statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.description: Jamal Mashburn scored 22 points and led the Charlotte Hornets past the Milwaukee Bucks 101-92 Monday night in his first game in three months.

related.description: Jamal Mashburn was activated from the injured list Monday after missing most of the season for the Charlotte Hornets with a lower abdominal injury.
related.linkText: Hornets' Silas delighted to have Mashburn back
related.title: Hornets expect immediate impact from star
related.headline: Hornets expect immediate impact from star

article.headline: Mashburn scores 22 in first game back

images.name: Mashburn_Jamal 020218 inline
images.caption: Jamal Mashburn drives hard against Anthony Mason on his way to 22 points.

article.linkText: Mashburn's smashing return leaves Bucks reeling
article.story:
MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Jamal Mashburn didn't show any ill-effects following a three-month layoff. "I didn't have much rust," Mashburn said after scoring 22 points and leading the Charlotte Hornets past the Milwaukee Bucks 101-92 Monday night in his first action since missing 42 games with a lower abdominal strain. "One thing about this injury, I was able to do some type of conditioning, even though it wasn't basketball conditioning," said Mashburn, who logged 44 minutes. And his mind didn't take a break during his absence. "I always thought about the game," Mashburn said. "I mentally prepared myself for this day. That's all I could pretty much do. I have a lot of experience out there playing basketball. It all came together. It was good to have a good start." Only six players scored for the Hornets, but all reached double figures, led by Elden Campbell with 24. Baron Davis had 20. The Hornets played with better poise and power with their leader back. "I've said so many times, you don't know what you miss until the guy comes back and gives you this kind of production," Hornets coach Paul Silas said. "He came back just at the right time." And the Bucks lost their leader at the worst time. They were without point guard Sam Cassell, who was sidelined with a sprained toe for the third time in four games, all of them losses. Without him, all nine Bucks who played turned the ball over, led by Ray Allen with six, as Milwaukee lost for the ninth time in 12 games and fell into a tie with Detroit atop the Central Division. "We have a lot of little things going wrong," Bucks coach George Karl said. "Different times, different games, different situations. We've just got to kind of weather the storm until we get Sam healthy. "What we've always worried about is now playing out, the one guy we couldn't afford to lose is Sam." Cassell said he won't be healthy for three weeks, and with backup Rafer Alston averaging less than four points, the Bucks would love to land a backup point guard with playoff experience by Thursday's trade deadline. But Karl said he didn't think that was going to happen. While the Bucks are slipping, the Hornets are getting healthy. Mashburn had 14 points by halftime, including 12 of the starters' 21 points in the first quarter as the Hornets grabbed the lead for good at the 1:03 mark. Mashburn's biggest play until a jumper that made it 99-92 with 39 seconds left in the game was a breakaway late in the first half that drew a foul from a backpedaling Alston, who was so upset over the call that he left the court and stood beside a table on press row, drawing a technical. P.J. Brown sank the technical shot, and Mashburn's two foul shots gave the Hornets a 12-point cushion. Behind Davis's 14 second-quarter points, the Hornets took a 56-46 halftime lead that they stretched to 14 in the third quarter. A 3-pointer by Tim Thomas brought Milwaukee to 74-70 heading into the fourth quarter, and Allen's steal and dunk to start the final frame made it a 2-point game. The Bucks were still within two at 86-84 with five minuets left but couldn't get any closer. Campbell scored nine of the Hornets' last 15 points to keep the Bucks at bay. "We've fallen in a bad way," said Allen, who led Milwaukee with 27 points. "It's hard to explain. We've been bitten by the loss bug."

Game notes
Mashburn, the Hornets' leading scorer last season, was placed on the injured list on Nov. 20 after he hurt himself trying to pivot during practice. He was averaging 18 points, 6.8 rebounds and 3.9 assists. ... Allen was whistled for an uncharacteristic technical foul when he argued a non-call on a play in the third quarter in which he tripped and turned the ball over. ... Silas said Charlotte won't be dealing by the deadline because everybody wants Brown, Mashburn or Davis.
